facts.fact: Branch protection documentation examples should default to enforce_admins: true and allow_force_pushes: false. Permissive examples get copy-pasted without thought.
facts.recommendation: Always show secure defaults first, with opt-out instructions for flexibility.

facts.fact: GitHub branch protection required_status_checks.contexts must use actual job names like 'Lint & Format', not workflow names like 'Tests & Quality'. Using workflow names causes merges to be blocked even when all jobs pass.
facts.recommendation: Verify check names by running 'gh pr checks <pr-number>' to see actual names.

provenance.context: Discovered when merge was blocked despite all checks passing

facts.fact: Reply-confirmation regex patterns like '^agreed...' match prefixes, so 'Agreed, but please add tests' incorrectly becomes NON_ACTIONABLE. Either anchor to end-of-string or require explicit fix confirmation wording.
facts.recommendation: Test regex patterns with adversarial examples that include conditional phrases.

facts.fact: Docstrings must accurately reflect implementation. If a function catches exceptions and returns None instead of raising, document 'Returns: None if...' not 'Raises: ...'.
facts.recommendation: Review docstrings after changing exception handling behavior.

facts.fact: Run formatters (black) before committing to avoid CI failures. Black formatting failures are preventable.
facts.recommendation: Use pre-commit hooks or add 'black --check .' to local workflow.

facts.fact: When generating human-readable action items, use the filtered CIStatus (after --exclude-checks applied), not raw API data. Otherwise action items incorrectly say 'CI failing' when status is READY.
facts.recommendation: Build filtered models before generating user-facing text.

provenance.context: Action items showed 'CI failing' even when --exclude-checks made status READY
